content.raw:
On saucy, I get the following warnings from code_check:


```
#!c++

[gazebo/rendering/OculusCamera.cc:560]: (style) The scope of the variable 'cam' can be reduced.
[gazebo/rendering/OculusCamera.cc:610]: (style) The scope of the variable 'cam' can be reduced.

```

I think you just need to move the declaration of `cam` inside the for loops.
content.html:
On saucy, I get the following warnings from code_check:

[gazebo/rendering/OculusCamera.cc:560]: (style) The scope of the variable 'cam' can be reduced.

I think you just need to move the declaration of cam inside the for loops.

update.description:
Oculus support in Gazebo will be provided as an optional feature. You will need to install the Oculus SDK that will provide libOculusVR.so and OVR.h, among other header files.

How to test it:

* Install Oculus SDK.
* Add the following content to ~/.gazebo/gui.ini:

```
#!c++

[oculus]
x=0
y=0
visual=camera::link::visual
autolaunch=0
```
* Execute:

```
#!C++

gazebo ../worlds/camera.world
```
* Click on Window->Oculus Rift.

Alternatively, you can set:
```
#!c++

autolaunch=1
```
and run:
```
#!C++

gazebo ../worlds/camera.world
```

Here is a [test build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-quantal-amd64-gpu-nvidia/518/console).

You can use [this tutorial](http://gazebosim.org/tutorials/?tut=oculus) for testing the pull request.
update.title: Oculus Rift support

content.raw:
It could save some bugs reports to add to replace in the tutorial the cmake line by:

```
cmake .. -DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=/usr
```

So when you finish the gazebo compilation and try to launch it you won't get:
```
gazebo: error while loading shared libraries: libOculusVR.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
```
content.html:
It could save some bugs reports to add to replace in the tutorial the cmake line by:

cmake .. -DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=/usr

So when you finish the gazebo compilation and try to launch it you won't get:

gazebo: error while loading shared libraries: libOculusVR.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory

content.raw: It's done by Qt because the renderLayout is attached to the QWidget (OculusWindow). When oculusWindow is released, renderLayout will be deallocated too.
content.html: It's done by Qt because the renderLayout is attached to the QWidget (OculusWindow). When oculusWindow is released, renderLayout will be deallocated too.
